result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Sireci was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 8:57am [mo]
Defendant Richard A Sireci in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock submits Amended Information
Atty. De La Rosa admits service and waives reading
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3 of the Amended Information.

ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement; the Court reviews
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Sireci

On Count #1 of the Amended Information, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 30 months, with conditions:

--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges, to commence on  7/9/15 at 7:00pm.
---Mr. Sireci is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety; no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--no presence in bars, tavern, or liquor stores
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--No Contact with the Victim, Petra Trivunovic
--testing for illegal drug and alcohol use at frequency determined by Agent 
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee


Days credit for time already served:  2  days
The Court grants Mr. Sireci the opportunity to request expungement upon successful completion of Probation
recess: 9:33am
States motion to impeach the defendant with prior convictions
States notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant

Case called at 9:37am [mo]
Defendant Richard A Sireci in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that the Defense is prepared for Trial; but would like some additional time to negotiate to allow possible resolution.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that he will contact the Court if case will settle or proceed to Trial; shall the Case settle, plan for Plea/Sent on Thursday at 8:45 am
Atty De La Rosa is to contact the Court by 10:00 am tomorrow (6/17/15), to notify of settlement or trial proceeding.


The Court and Counsel discuss procedural matters of Trial:
--all witnesses ready and prepared for Trial
--2 days for trial
--5 strikes per side
--1 alternate
--jurors allowed to take notes and ask questions

State's 6/16/15 Notice of Intent to Admit Statements made by the Defendant:
The State will be allowed to admit statements made by the Defendant which are included in the Discovery materials which have been provided to Defense, if the State intends to introduce other statements attributed to the Defendant, that is State did not contain in Discovery materials or not provided to the Defense the State would need to bring that to the Courts attention as well as to the attention of Defense before stated in court.

State's 6/16/15 Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions: 
The Court grants the motion to impeach
2 priors with the assumption that both charges have been convicted; otherwise one prior; ADA Shock to research.
recess: 9:50am

NEXT: (1)Possible Plea & Sentencing--6/18/15 at 8:45am (2)Jury Trial--6/22/15 and 6/23/15 at 8:30am
Jury trial on June 22 & 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Copy of letter from the State to SPD ref discovery
Jury trial on May 4 & 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Case called at 8:36am [MO]
Defendant Richard A Sireci in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that the parties do not have resolution and wish to proceed to trial.
Counsel agrees a 2 day trial is necessary. Counsel agree they can be ready for trial in 60 days. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court clarifies to Mr. Sireci that the April 28th hearing date is the final opportunity to enter a change of plea or other case resolution. Thereafter the Court intends to proceed to Jury Trial.
The Court indicates Mr. Sireci's conditions of bond remain the same.
Defense indicates they wish to withdraw the NGI plea.
The Court grants the motion. 
Recess: 8:43am

NEXT: FSSC: 4/28/2015 at 3:00pm Jury Trial: May 4 and 5, 2015 at 8:30am
Status conference on February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 1:36 pm
Defendant Richard A Sireci in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB listed on the criminal complaint is correct.
Attorney De La Rosa provides updated address to the Court.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; Count #1 & #2 charges and maximum penalties recited; waiver of reading of charge and maximum penalties for Count #3.
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Counts #1- #3.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 CASH bond, with conditions:  
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Petra Trivunovic
-No presence at the residence of Petra Trivunovic
-Maintain absoute sobriety
-Take all medications as prescribed

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:49 pm
